kj8twdkxText:
Brintellix® is as efficacious as venlafaxine in
the treatment of MDD patients in Asia
kj8twdkzText:
In a randomised, double-blind, 8-week study comparing the efficacy and tolerability of fixed dose treatment with vortioxetine (10 mg/day) versus venlafaxine extended release
tablet (XR) 150 mg/day in major depressive disorder patients. The primary endpoint was a change from baseline to week 8 in MADRS total score. At week 8, non-inferiority
was established with a deference of -1.2 points in favor of vortioxetine (95% CI: -3.0 to 0.6). Patients included in this study were required to have a MADRS total score ≥26
at the baseline visit. The MADRS total score decreased (improved) from 32.3+4.6 at baseline to 13.6+9.6 (vortioxetine: n=209) and from 32.3+4.5 to 14.8+10.4 (venlafaxine
XR:n=215). *MADRS - Montgomery–Åsberg Depression Rating Scale
kj8twdl7Text:
Brintellix® was better tolerated than venlafaxine as shown by less number of patients who withdrew from the
study (18.0% versus 27.4%) and less number of adverse events 6.6% versus 13.7%)
kj8twdl8Text: Study conducted in China, South Korea, Taiwan and Thailand
kj8twdl9Text: Estimated change in MADRS total scores from baseline to Week 8
kj8twdlaText: (ANCOVA, FAS, LOCF)1
Brintellix_4754999406: 1. Wang G et al. Curr Med Res Opin 2015;31:785-794.
